title: Reflective Thinking-Inducing Curriculum Integrating Flipped Learning and Self-Regulated Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental digital logic (DL) concepts
context.additional_context: Mobile learning via personal devices (BYOD) in a flipped classroom setting, developing self-regulated learning strategies through reflective activities. Project-based assessments measure outcomes, suitable for beginners in electrical/electronic fields.

learning_goals: Learners can establish self-directed learning plans at least three times a week using reflective thinking questionnaires in a flipped learning environment
Learners can achieve over 85% completion rate in pre-learning preparation by applying self-regulated learning strategies (time management, focus strategies, self-assessment, etc.)
Learners can improve project execution capabilities by 20% by analyzing learning obstacles and proposing improvement plans through reflective journaling
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
